page.title: 13Village shop in Ellastone.
page.content: We interviewed the village postmaster who owns the post office and the village shop.He delivers newspapers, bread and groceries and he has about 175 customers a day.He gets up at 6:50 in the morning.He goes 26 miles a day and delivers to 5 villages.People would miss their deliveries.He said he doesn't like his job because he doesn't like seeing the same miserable faces every day. During the day he sorts newspapers,he sorts the bread,loads the car,has breakfast,delivers to Ellastone and Wootton and delivers to Roston and Snelston.Then has dinner.In the afternoon he does bookwork,deals with orders,and balances the post office. The postmaster thought old people would miss their pension being taken out to people and the local availability of food.
